intro: Pachylobus balsamifer, commonly known as the balsam tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy, pink or red flowers in clusters. The balsamifer is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
